intro: Allionia incarnata f. cylindrica, commonly known as the pink cardinal flower, is a striking herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, tubular red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are opposite and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun. Its striking appearance makes it a popular choice for wetland gardens and native plant landscapes.
